16:T2336,data:image/png;base64,:T2836,data:image/png;base64,:[["$","p",null,{"children":"You see, I think of myself as someone who is able to admit when he has made a mistake.\nAs such, I am not afraid to say that time has proven my initial, optimistic evaluation of Azure to be more than\nwrong."}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":"In my first post about this topic I toured the online portal of azure, in which I configured a few basic infrastructure\nbuilding blocks and compared them with their AWS equivalents. But this approach has a glaring issue: This would not\nbe how Azure would be used in production."}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":"In fact, in the best case scenario, I would never have visited the azure portal ever again, because I would have been\nable to work exclusively via an infrastructure-as-code language. This is how I use AWS at least and this is, in my\nopinion, the only way how a cloud infrastructure provider can be used in a professional setting. Without it, one can\nneither share nor reproduce a cloud based application."}],"\n",["$","h2",null,{"children":"IaC Options with Azure"}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":"After a few test runs of our first Azure-based application in an environment that was created by hand we wanted to prepare\nthe software for production use.\nThe first thing we wanted to do was to consolidate the pieces of infrastructure I had manually created into an IaC document.\nTo do so, we had to decide which IaC language to use beforehand. At the time of our evaluation we had three options:"}],"\n",["$","ol",null,{"children":["\n",["$","li",null,{"children":"ARM templates: A terribly named, verbose, JSON flavour"}],"\n",["$","li",null,{"children":"Bicep templates: A DSL which transpiles into ARM templates"}],"\n",["$","li",null,{"children":"Terraform: A meta IaC language by HashiCorp"}],"\n"]}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":["ARM templates (",["$","a",null,{"href":"https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/blob/521795efc34e79d52b27975fa416c82a3533bb9a/quickstarts/microsoft.web/mobile-app-create/azuredeploy.json","children":"example"}],")\nwere already kinda deprecated when we started, as we were greeted with this info-box on the ARM start page:"]}],"\n",["$","$L12",null,{"src":{"src":"/_next/static/media/bicep-arm-deprecation-warning-2.2ebd68ca.png","height":203,"width":902,"blurDataURL":"data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAgAAAACCAMAAABSSm3fAAAABlBMVEURTSAPNxjliyRoAAAACXBIWXMAAAsTAAALEwEAmpwYAAAAGHRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBtYXRlLXNjcmVlbnNob3TIlvBKAAAAEElEQVR4nGNggABGKM3ACAAAHQADkUumrQAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==","blurWidth":8,"blurHeight":2},"alt":"A screenshot of the Azure ARM deprecation warning"}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":"This left us with two candidates: Terraform and Bicep. After some discussion we settled for Bicep because of two reasons:\nFirstly, we felt that we didn't need the additional abstraction layer that Terraform provided and that we probably would\nhave to break out into ARM or Bicep any way if a certain edge case we needed to address could not be fixed with Terraform.\nAt the same time we would not be able to benefit from the advertised upsides of terraform like the multi-cloud capability as\nwe'd be stuck on Azure. We had also made many positive experiences with AWS Cloudformation/SAM which ultimately led us\nto believe that Microsoft's solutions could not be that much worse, could it?"}],"\n",["$","h2",null,{"children":"Documentation"}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":["To illustrate my points about the state of IaC at Azure we'll take a closer look at a ",["$","a",null,{"href":"https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/blob/118f0df56f6eca1d5672963c2bb8907f701ca3f5/quickstarts/microsoft.web/function-app-create-dynamic/main.bicep","children":"simple template"}],"\nfrom the official collection of quickstart templates by Microsoft.\nTo be precise, we'll create a plain function app\n(which is the ",["$","a",null,{"href":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/architecture/aws-professional/services#compute","children":"official"}]," equivalent of an AWS Lambda function)."]}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":["As you can see, our cloud primitive \"serverless code runner\" actually consists of three resources:\nA ",["$","code",null,{"children":"Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"}],", which provides a filesystem to host our function code,\na ",["$","code",null,{"children":"Microsoft.Web/serverfarms"}],", which\ndictates how our code is run: serverless or on a provisioned machine,\nhow many nines we can expect when it comes to the uptime and so on, and finally a ",["$","code",null,{"children":"Microsoft.Web/sites"}]," which\ncontains the settings for our code runner. The\nexample also adds a ",["$","code",null,{"children":"Microsoft.Insights/components"}]," resource to add additional logging, but out of goodwill I'll\nignore this one as it is not strictly necessary."]}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":["Now, lets say you have provisioned your first function app by copying this template, and you'd now\nlike to modify it. Maybe you are like me and would like to know what the other possible ",["$","code",null,{"children":"serverfarm"}],"\ntiers are, other than the ",["$","code",null,{"children":"Dynamic"}],"-tier which is used in ",["$","code",null,{"children":"hostingPlan.sku.tier"}],".\nSo you head on over to the ",["$","a",null,{"href":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/templates/microsoft.web/2022-03-01/serverfarms?pivots=deployment-language-bicep","children":"reference page for the serverfarm resource"}],"\nand check the structure of a ",["$","code",null,{"children":"SkuDescription"}],":"]}],"\n",["$","$L12",null,{"src":{"src":"/_next/static/media/bicep-sku-description.dc51dbeb.png","height":426,"width":671,"blurDataURL":"data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAgAAAAFCAMAAABPT11nAAAABlBMVEUaGhoiIiJbxTWgAAAACXBIWXMAAAsTAAALEwEAmpwYAAAAGHRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBtYXRlLXNjcmVlbnNob3TIlvBKAAAAGElEQVR4nGNgZGRkgABGMIAw4CIMDEgiAAH9ABTD0k3JAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC","blurWidth":8,"blurHeight":5},"alt":"A screenshot of the SkuDescription of a Microsoft.Web/serverfarms resource"}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":["We have now learned that ",["$","code",null,{"children":"tier"}]," must be a ",["$","code",null,{"children":"string"}],". That's it. As you have probably already guessed, it\ncannot be ANY string, as only a few ones from the infinite pool of possible strings are allowed. It would\nbe cool if they'd be listed somewhere on this page."]}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":["If you check the rest of the attributes you'll see that their descriptions are equally useless.\nJust to name a few additional examples: The description of ",["$","code",null,{"children":"AppServicePlanProperties.spotExpirationTime"}],"\nreads ",["$","code",null,{"children":"The time when the server farm expires. Valid only if it is a spot server farm."}]," and it must be\na string ",["$","code",null,{"children":"string"}],". So we'll probably have to format this time values somehow when we need to specify it,\nbut how? Can we simply drop in an epoch timestamp? Does it taken an\n",["$","a",null,{"href":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601","children":"ISO-8601"}]," string?\nCan we use timezones or does it have to be in UTC?"]}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":["There is also the ",["$","code",null,{"children":"AppServicePlanProperties.targetWorkerCount"}]," which dictates the ",["$","code",null,{"children":"Scaling worker count."}],"\nand must be of type ",["$","code",null,{"children":"int"}],". Can I specify any integer value, without any restrictions? Are 1073741824 workers possible?\nIs the worker count dependent on the function tier? How does it relate to the\n",["$","code",null,{"children":"maximumElasticWorkerCount"}],"? What is the default value?"]}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":["This level of documentation is the norm with all azure resources. Just to make sure that this is no\nfluke, let us head over to the documentation of the ",["$","code",null,{"children":"Microsoft.Web/sites"}]," resource, which, if you remember,\nis the equivalent of a lambda function and should thus be one of the most used resourcetypes."]}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":["I am specifically interested in the ",["$","code",null,{"children":"siteConfig.appSettings"}]," options, which are really obscure even in the\n",["$","a",null,{"href":"https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/blob/118f0df56f6eca1d5672963c2bb8907f701ca3f5/quickstarts/microsoft.web/function-app-create-dynamic/main.bicep#L61","children":"example quickstart template"}],":"]}],"\n",["$","pre",null,{"children":["$","code",null,{"className":"language-bicep","children":"appSettings: [\n    {\n      name: 'AzureWebJobsStorage'\n      value: 'DefaultEndpointsProtocol=https;AccountName=${storageAccountName};EndpointSuffix=${environment().suffixes.storage};AccountKey=${storageAccount.listKeys().keys[0].value}'\n    }\n    {\n      name: 'WEBSITE_CONTENTAZUREFILECONNECTIONSTRING'\n      value: 'DefaultEndpointsProtocol=https;AccountName=${storageAccountName};EndpointSuffix=${environment().suffixes.storage};AccountKey=${storageAccount.listKeys().keys[0].value}'\n    }\n//...\n"}]}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":["How does this ",["$","code",null,{"children":"WEBSITE_CONTENTAZUREFILECONNECTIONSTRING"}]," work? What are the other possible ",["$","code",null,{"children":"appSettings"}],"?\nWhich are required and what are the default values for those that are not? Let's check the documentation!"]}],"\n",["$","$L12",null,{"src":{"src":"/_next/static/media/bicep-appSettings.ec1f94cb.png","height":675,"width":832,"blurDataURL":"data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAgAAAAGCAMAAADJ2y/JAAAAGFBMVEUbGxwfHx8XFxcmJiYeHh4WFhYYGRgmJiXen4uNAAAABnRSTlP+/iqeXbfUKE5SAAAACXBIWXMAAC4jAAAuIwF4pT92AAAAGXRFWHRDb21tZW50AENyZWF0ZWQgd2l0aCBHSU1QV4EOFwAAACtJREFUeJw1ykEKwDAQw8Bxmq7//+PQQG9ikJoMS6K9MZpfIsvTfs9rY3AADIMAbn3gSnMAAAAASUVORK5CYII=","blurWidth":8,"blurHeight":6},"alt":""}],"\n",["$","h2",null,{"children":"Deployment"}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":"Now, Azure wouldn't be the first, nor the last tool where the documentation is unusable. There is\nalways the try-and-fail method. Let's just throw together a simple deployment, run it, and see what the\nerrors are."}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":"There are two basic problems with this approach when working with Azure. To begin with, most\ndeployments take ages. You'll want to provision a new serverless mssql database? Come back in 40 minutes.\nYou'll need an API Management instance? That'll also set you back like 40 minutes. But don't worry, we'll\nsend you an emails when it's ready."}],"\n",["$","$L12",null,{"src":{"src":"/_next/static/media/bicep-email-edit.75416465.png","height":413,"width":1069,"blurDataURL":"$16","blurWidth":8,"blurHeight":3},"alt":""}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":"Now, let's assume the deployment did not work and after around half an hour you receive an\nerror message. After all this time you've spent waiting, it surely is detailed and allows\nyou to fix the problems with your template right? Well, I've compiled some examples for you:"}],"\n",["$","$L12",null,{"src":{"src":"/_next/static/media/bicep-error-compilation.502b908b.png","height":301,"width":897,"blurDataURL":"$17","blurWidth":8,"blurHeight":3},"alt":""}],"\n",["$","h2",null,{"children":"Degradation"}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":"For the last point I'd like to make I can only offer anecdotal evidence, as this incident only happened once, but this\nwas enough to get me worried."}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":"In a resource stack we had deployed on our production system we had a resource which looked like this"}],"\n",["$","pre",null,{"children":["$","code",null,{"className":"language-bicep","children":"resource appservicePlan 'Microsoft.Web/serverfarms@2021-03-01' = {\n  name: appservice_plan_name\n  location: location\n  tags: tag_values\n  sku: {\n    name: 'Y1'\n    tier: 'Dynamic'\n  }\n}\n"}]}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":"This stack was deployed and updated countless times between our production and staging/test environments and we never\nencountered a problem with it. Through a bit of a lull in the development (it was the holiday season) changes to the\nsystem slowed down, and we did not run a deployment for a few weeks."}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":["When work resumed in earnest, the resource group could not be deployed anymore. Azure helpfully reported\n",["$","code",null,{"children":"Object reference not set to an instance of an object."}]," and that was it. We had to try and fail our way through\nthe deployment, removing resources until it worked, until be determined that the resource that is show above is the culprit.\nThis confused us to no small amount, as this resource had been in the stack for months, and it never caused any issues."]}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":["In the end we found out that we had to add the attribute ",["$","code",null,{"children":"kind: 'linux'"}]," to the ",["$","code",null,{"children":"appservicePlan"}],". This got the deployment\nworking again, but if this really was the root cause of the issue or if it can occur again some other time, that we don't know.\nIt does not really look like it is required, as there are official examples about\n(like the one I ",["$","a",null,{"href":"https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/blob/118f0df56f6eca1d5672963c2bb8907f701ca3f5/quickstarts/microsoft.web/function-app-create-dynamic/main.bicep#L41","children":"linked above"}],")\nwhich seem to work without this attribute."]}],"\n",["$","h2",null,{"children":"Conclusion"}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":"After you've read about all the trouble we had with Azure and Bicep/ARM you propably understand why I had to come back\nto the topic and correct my initial conclusions about the platform."}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":"To be clear: After all these experiences I'll probably try to avoid Azure for some time. In my opinion, a cloud platform\nwithout a reliable, well documented IaC language really is not usable for any production use-case."}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":"You may now argue that we should have used Terraform or something else from the beginning and that the platform Azure\ncannot be judged by the performance of it's IaC language, but I really cannot let that one count. When the official,\nsupported and advertised way of doing infrastructure-as-code on a platform does not work, then they should not advertise it, and\nit becomes a flaw of the platform.
